tp:docstring.p: This interface supports controlling which contacts are allowed to initiate text chats, incoming calls, and other forms of communication as supported by the underlying protocol. The policies supported for different communication methods on this connection are listed in the SupportedPolicies property. The current configuration is held in ActivePolicies; it can be modified using SetPolicy, and changes are signalled by PolicyChanged.

tp:mapping.name: Active_Policies_Map
tp:mapping.tp:docstring: A mapping of communication methods (channel types), and their associated policy.

tp:member.name: Channel_Type
tp:member.tp:docstring: The channel interface with the policy.

tp:member.name: Active_Policy
tp:member.tp:docstring: The active policy for this channel type.

property.name: SupportedPolicies
property.tp:docstring: The communication policies supported by this connection.

tp:docstring.p: The active communication policies on this connection. Communication methods that are not in this mapping are considered open.

Changes to this property are signalled by PolicyChanged.

method.name: SetPolicy
method.tp:docstring: Set a policy for a communication method (channel type). Depending on the server or protocol, more than one communication method could be bound to the same policy, if calling this method on one channel type changes the policy on another channel type, the PolicyChanged signal that would follow would include all the channel types that have an altered policy.

arg.name: Channel_Type
arg.tp:docstring: The channel type to set the policy for.

arg.name: Policy
arg.tp:docstring: The policy to set for this channel.

signal.name: PolicyChanged
signal.tp:docstring: ActivePolicies has changed. This occurs when the server unilaterally changed the policy or SetPolicy has been called.

arg.name: Changed_Policies
arg.tp:docstring: A subset of the active policies that have changed.

tp:docstring.p: The communication methods (channel types), and the policies that can be applied to them. This is server and protocol dependant.
Grouped channel types will always have the same policy applied to them.
tp:docstring.tp:rationale: Different protocols have different limitations to the granularity of communication policies. One protocol might be able to set a different policy for VoIP calls and text chat, while another protocol might only be able to set one policy to both VoIP and text chat.

tp:member.name: Channel_Types
tp:member.tp:docstring: A list of channel interfaces that support these policies.
